title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.3 EMERGENCY CASH TRANSFER

description.narrative: Output: 5.3 Unconditional emergency cash transfers are received by poor and vulnerable Social Welfare Fund beneficiaries, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more children in Yemen and their families who live in poverty (income and multi-dimensional) access adequate social protection and social services

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF PLANNING AND INTERNATIO COOPERATION

sector.narrative: Management and Operations support at CO

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output: 5.3 Unconditional emergency cash transfers are received by poor and vulnerable Social Welfare Fund beneficiaries

description.narrative:
Three payment cycles of the Yemen Unconditional Cash Transfer Project were completed in 2021 reaching over 1.45 million poor and vulnerable household beneficiaries (55% male-, 45% female-headed households), impacting over 9 million people - about a third of the country's population.  The Project was successfully implemented across the 22 governorates and 333 districts of Yemen despite the difficulties of the increasingly volatile security situation, infrastructure limitations and deterioration, and COVID-19 pandemic.

| Status:Met | As-of Date:10/01/2022
